title.narrative: Strategic Strengthening of HIV/AIDS Information Systems in Kenya

description.narrative:
The government of Kenya declared the HIV/AIDS epidemic a national disaster in 1999. Since then, the Kenyan government and the Kenyan National AIDS Control Council (NACC) have made great strides in treatment and prevention of HIV/AIDs. However, the NACC still faces many challenges including the Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) of its programs and services. The lack of accurate, timely and complete data can result in ineffective and problematic programs with no way clear framework for improvement.
Through the Strategic Strengthening of HIV/AIDS Information Systems (SSIS) Project, Amref Health Africa aims to strengthen the capacity in Kenya to collect and use surveillance data and manage national HIV/AIDS projects.

Through funding from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) and the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR), Amref Health Africa:
1) Builds the capacity of health workers on M&E, data management, and analytical and reporting skills, as well as data use for decision making.
2) Supports the reviewing, revising, and implementation of a simplified M&E framework, reporting tools, policies and standard operating procedures.
3) Strengthens M&E coordination and collaboration at national, provincial and district levels.
4) Works with partners to improve the quality of HIV care and treatment through training clinical, medical and laboratory staff, and through the use of simplified data collection and analysis tools.
